overall_summary: Activity centered on UX and access-control changes for public agents (message limits, public agent UI states, improved summaries) alongside continued community friction around AI16z→ElizaOS token migration and wallet compatibility. Core-dev discussion referenced ongoing PR review work (streaming-related) and plugin development (plugin-github updates and a new plugin-git).
key_facts: In elizaOS/eliza, PR #6301 ("chore(license): update year to 2026") was merged, updating the LICENSE year to 2026.
Between Jan 2–3, 2026, elizaOS/eliza recorded 14 new issues, 1 new pull request (merged), and 4 active contributors.

GitHub issues #6311–#6315 were opened by borisudovicic, including proposals to improve chat summaries, limit unauthenticated messages to ~2–3, separate public agent states, show chat number on public agent cards, and change free credits from $5 to $1.
The elizaOS Discord on 2026-01-02 logged 108 messages from 30 users.
In the core-devs channel, Stan confirmed that singleShot should support parameters to prevent action problems.
Odilitime stated they were working on updates to plugin-github and creating a plugin-git.
In the discussion channel, multiple users reported AI16z token migration/wallet issues, including tokens not showing after transfer to Phantom wallets.
In the partners channel, DorianD shared the GitHub project VersusControl/ai-infrastructure-agent and proposed developing an AI-driven cost-reduction and migration agent for moving workloads off AWS.
open_questions: What will happen to Ai16z tokens bought after snapshot? Can they be migrated?
Anyone have an idea if it'd be possible to import an entire codebase as an agent to eliza?
Can I use plugins that were not added to the cloud from the docs?
Could Jeju use AI infrastructure agents to create a cost reduction and migration tool from AWS?

new_issues_prs.title: Change free credits from $5 to $1
new_issues_prs.author: borisudovicic
new_issues_prs.significance: Token/credit policy proposal affecting onboarding and costs.

new_issues_prs.title: Public agent cards should have chat number
new_issues_prs.author: borisudovicic
new_issues_prs.significance: Requested UX change to display engagement metric on public agents.

new_issues_prs.title: Separate public agent states
new_issues_prs.author: borisudovicic
new_issues_prs.significance: Defines distinct UX for unauthenticated visitors vs authenticated users vs owners.

new_issues_prs.title: Limit messages for non-signed up user to ~2-3
new_issues_prs.author: borisudovicic
new_issues_prs.significance: Proposes gating public-agent usage for unauthenticated users.

new_issues_prs.title: Chat summaries don't really make much sense. Can we improve
new_issues_prs.author: borisudovicic
new_issues_prs.significance: Quality issue on summaries in the chat experience.

overall_focus.claim: GitHub activity emphasized public-agent UX and onboarding gates (unauthenticated message limits, public agent state separation, engagement display on agent cards) plus a routine license-year update.

discord_updates.summary: Conversation included token migration questions and wallet issues (reports of tokens not showing after transfers to Phantom), plus a brief redirection of an NFT smart contract question to the coders channel and mention of external hardware/plugin integration.

Community discussed contributing and plugins; an unanswered question asked whether an entire GitHub codebase could be imported as an agent, and Odilitime shared the plugin-github repo while noting ongoing updates and work on a new plugin-git.
DorianD proposed an AI 'cost reduction and migration agent' to analyze AWS usage and migrate workloads to cheaper alternatives, referencing the VersusControl/ai-infrastructure-agent project.
Stan referenced ongoing PR review work (including PR #6286) and confirmed the need for parameter support in singleShot to prevent action problems.

user_feedback.feedback_summary: Users reported AI16z token migration difficulties, including tokens not appearing after transfers to Phantom and requests for WalletConnect/Tangem support and clearer migration instructions.

A set of GitHub issues proposed onboarding and monetization-related UX changes for public agents (unauthenticated message limits, reduced free credits, clearer public agent states, and more informative chat summaries).

strategic_insights.theme: Public-agent onboarding funnel and usage gating
strategic_insights.insight: Multiple GitHub issues propose differentiating public-agent UX by authentication/ownership state and introducing tight limits for unauthenticated usage, alongside reduced free credits and improved chat summaries.
implications_or_questions: What is the target conversion flow for public agents (trial length, gating triggers, and signup prompts)?
Do credit changes ($5→$1) align with planned token/Cloud economics and acquisition strategy?

strategic_insights.insight: Discord coders and daily summaries reference ongoing work on plugin-github and creation of plugin-git, indicating continued investment in repository-aware tooling for agents and developer workflows.
implications_or_questions: Should plugin-git be prioritized to support broader SCM workflows beyond GitHub?

strategic_insights.theme: AI-driven cloud cost reduction as a potential product line
strategic_insights.insight: Partners channel discussion proposed an AI infrastructure agent to analyze AWS usage and support migrations to lower-cost alternatives, positioning 'migration/cost optimization agents' as a potential SMB-oriented offering.
implications_or_questions: Is this aligned with Jeju/Cloud/Babylon near-term roadmap, and what data access model would be required to operate safely?

market_analysis.observation: Discord discussion included token-related questions about AI16z migration and informal comparisons between DegenAI and ElizaOS tokens.
market_analysis.relevance: Token migration friction can impact community trust and participation; token comparisons can influence narrative and adoption.

market_analysis.observation: On 2025-12-31, a market-focused discussion referenced economic cycle theories and Raoul Pal's debt monetization hypothesis (liquidity increases, lower rates, or USD devaluation).
market_analysis.relevance: Macro narratives were discussed in-community and may shape expectations around risk-on assets and token markets.
